title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1627-6.2 - Termination by tenant
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 §§ 1627-6.2 - Termination by tenant

State Regulations
(a) Tenants
intending to vacate must sign a completed notice of intent to vacate. This
notice shall include reason(s) for vacating. (b) Tenants should be encouraged to give as
much advanced notice as possible; however, at least one month's written notice
is required as they are liable for rent until the end of the required period of
notice or until the effective date of the new lease, whichever is
earlier. (c) Possession of
apartments abandoned by tenants may be recovered by the authority without legal
proceedings. However, if tenant has left any possessions or if there is any
doubt as to whether the apartment has actually been abandoned, the authority's
counsel shall be contacted for advice as to what action should be taken to gain
possession. Notes
